summary: Internal email chain from July 23, 2019, regarding an incident involving Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The document describes staff finding Epstein with marks on his neck, his placement on suicide watch, his claim that his cellmate tried to kill him, and subsequent medical and psychological assessments. It also includes requests for a clearer memo to be forwarded to higher authorities.

events.title: Epstein Found with Neck Marks in MCC Cell
events.description: On July 23, 2019, at approximately 1:27 a.m., staff in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) found inmate Jeffrey Epstein lying on the floor in a fetal position with red marks on his neck. He was unresponsive initially, placed in restraints, and moved to a suicide watch cell.

events.title: Epstein's Medical and Psychological Assessment
events.description: Epstein was medically assessed at 6:30 a.m., showing a circular line of erythema on his neck but no significant distress. He was evaluated by a psychologist at 9:10 a.m. and remained on suicide watch for observation.

events.title: Review for General Population Placement
events.description: Following the incident, prison staff reviewed Epstein's case for potential placement in the general population in Unit 7 South and were seeking an appropriate cellmate.

keyFacts: On July 23, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell with red marks on his neck, claiming his cellmate had attempted to kill him.
Epstein was placed on suicide watch following the incident, though medical assessment noted he was 'smiling' and in 'no apparent distress.'
Epstein told staff he had informed his attorney about the alleged harassment and attack by his cellmate.
The document reflects internal confusion and a request for a clearer memo to be sent to higher authorities like the IPPA and the Director.
The incident occurred while Epstein was awaiting trial on federal charges, raising questions about his safety and treatment in custody.
